intro: Pisum sativum var. balticum, commonly known as the Baltic pea, is a subspecies of the common pea native to Eastern Europe and parts of Russia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, typically green or purple flowers. The pods are usually slender and contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional cuisines. This variety is well adapted to cooler climates and is often cultivated for its nutritional value and ornamental appeal. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for both agricultural and horticultural purposes.
